documents.document: The word is "expedite" not "expediate" #TV1News #WendyPetrie
@GuardianBooks @MsRachelCooke Have you seen Sarah Laing's Mansfield and Me? Exceptionally good graphic novel from New Zealand.
Worst earthquake I've felt in Wellington. House shook from side to side. Lights swinging. Went on for ages. #eqnz
@susanhillwriter Characterisation and plot a perfect amalgamation.
@ChristineBusby Congratulations Christine. What a journey you've had since you joined "Resources"!
Island Bay people please keep an eye out for my friend's Burmese cat Jack, last seen in Clyde St. DM me or @Lucylockett1 if you find him
Not sure why chiropractors can treat backs but Maori healers can't. Placebo effect for both : https://t.co/fdjIuTgMQn via @nzlistener
Jeep Cherokee ad on @TVNZ is quite disturbing. Appears to show hands prison a woman's legs apart.
#Steinhardt2016 @GemmaPeacocke awarded Excellence in Graduate Music Composition! Mama's so proud.
All the way from New Zealand#Stein hard 20th Congratulations @GemmaPeacocke
Food writers, where are broad beans available? Not the foul frozen ones but the fresh variety beloved by trendy recipe writers.
Watching surfers at Lyall Bay, they'd be better off body surfing. 9 out of 10 can't get a ride on their board beyond 10 secs.
Feel sick about this. Jesse Ferris- Bromley convicted of manslaughter of Virginia Ford. He beat her to death & got 8 years. Bastard.
@TVONENZ it's John Kerry who is the US secretary of state, not John Carey. Proof read your captions!
@jonbridges66 Loved your poem about roman sandals pub years ago in @nzlistener. Cannot find & would be happy to read it if you can provide.
Emily Cooper @TV3nz twice says Preston found "not guilty"! Cockup.
What's up with wifi service in Buckley Rd Wellington @vodafoneNZ? Have been trying to connect my Kindle for over an hour.
@NYTFashion Influenced by the young Boy George?
@AirFranceUS @GemmaPeacocke For 11 days we have requested that you honour your obligation to get Gemma's bags delivered. WHEN WILL YOU DO IT
@AirFranceUS Is there any chance Gemma will get her suitcases back, or have they been stolen or lost by your partner company Geodis?
@AirFranceUS Do you mean receipts for the replacement of items? Some are irreplaceable. Can you provide a link to the claim form please.
@AirFranceUS Please honour your commitment to reunite Gemma with her suitcases today. Send someone to the partner company to retrieve them!
@AirFranceUS Have you had a response from the baggage department on the delivery of @GemmaPeacocke 's luggage 8 days after she arrived?
@AirFranceUS What responsibility does @AirFranceUS take for retrieving the bags you lost from @Geodis your partner company? Has been a week.
@AirFranceUS Can you please inform us what time @GemmaPeacocke's suitcases will be delivered? Thanks
@AirFranceUS @GemmaPeacocke will be thrilled to receive her bags one week after she arrived in Paris. At last she'll have warm clothes &meds
Should Red Peak be included as an option in the flag referendum? I say Yes http://t.co/73EGFLu2hS
@AirFranceUS @GeodisGroup Will @GemmaPeacocke's suitcases be delivered today? Contains asthma meds,warm clothes,essential for health/safety.
@GeodisGroup @airfranceus My daughter @GemmaPeacocke has been waiting 6 days for her bags to be delivered in Paris.Please action urgently.
@AirFrance Gemma has been waiting 6 days for her bags that contain asthma meds. Please require Geodis to deliver now https://t.co/30N9GKT4Bl
@PaulCathalifaud My daughter's bags also lost 5 days by @airfrance @AirFranceUS & maybe at Skyroad.Did you go to police? What compensation?
@airfrance Hello, do you have anything to report on where my daughter Gemma's luggage is?
@airfrance Gemma's bags are with Skyroad in Paris. Please call Skyroad and get them delivered today!
@airfrance What time do baggage dept employees start work in France? It's now 11 hours since I tweeted you & 6 days since you failed her.
@airfrance What time today can my daughter expect delivery of her luggage?
@airfrance I hope to hear from you within the next hour. Perhaps you could contact the courier company Air France uses & demand delivery.
@airfrance The ref: CDGAF43933
@airfrance How are you getting on with the missing baggage investigation? I see you're there for people 24/7.
@airfrance Have sent it by direct message.
@airfrance when will you deliver my daughter's luggage? She's waited 4 days in Paris & has no clothes or meds. This is really poor service!
Love T.C.Boyle's novel "The harder they come" but my hair now "the absolutely dead marmoreal white of the rest of the duffers" unlike T.C's!
What an oversight not to include this flag in the final 40! Check out this #NZflag design I found on @flagpostnz: http://t.co/tbdFg9XIJ7
Claire Fuller's novel "Our endless numbered days" is creepy. Despite its Grimmish beauty the ghastly fate of the daughter is too Gothic.
@francessrose Frances I've never stopped making meatloaf, though I draw the line at the recipe including banana my mother foisted on us once
Loving Lily King's Euphoria but she's hit a bum note with "bloated pink Australian faces". In 1932 Australian workers poor due to the Slump.
@LizzaAiken @PuffinBooks My favourite children's book which I read at 10, serialized in Princess mag. Still got Jonathan Cape ed 52 yrs on.
@StatisticsNZ says from 2013 census home ownership in NZ fell to 64.8% - lowest since 1951!
Reading Lily King's ex novel Euphoria based on Margaret Mead & husbands Fortune & Bateson.Reo Fortune a Kiwi but no NZ biography's published
The Rainbow Warrior - 30 years on http://t.co/OpNeK0Il3X via @nzherald
Lyall Bay on a wintery day. #Wellington http://t.co/QRrOu1qylY

@Jetstar_NZ Waikato Hospital biggest in Australasia, Ruakura/Fonterra agri hub, Waikato Uni, surrounding towns, 4th biggest city, The Magic!
@PopupGlobe Visionary scheme - very excited to learn about this.
New Zealand Government: Let Alex have the treatment he needs come out of an induced coma - it has alr... http://t.co/HhAdP67xcJ via @Change
I'm enjoying @JesseMulligan on @radionz. Great music and interesting interviews. Good Hamilton lad. #lovethetron
Kim Crawford's unoaked chardonnay is as sharp as vinegar. Ugh.
Who knew! Canaries were used in British coal mines until 1987 as environmental hazard early warning systems.
What a fantastic novel Rebecca Scherm's Unbecoming is. Rich in detail & psychological insight, it's a wholly engrossing thriller about love
@checkpointradionz Mary's always inquisatorial style is exhausting. Someone is always to blame. Let Jim bring illumination to the listeners.
Internet moved from glacial speed to defunct in Wellington @vodafoneNZ. What are you doing?
@AnnaESmaill For me: Ruth Park's The hole in the hill was the first kid's novel set in familiar place. In 1963 was unusual to get NZ books.
Now that I've renamed the sitting room the ironing/TV room I no longer care about constant presence of ironing board/crumpled clothing.
I have to watch TV programmes about OCD cleaners to galvanize myself to do housework #houseworkchronicles
Remembering my grandfather George Morris Ranstead 100 years ago at Gallipoli. http://t.co/yFqinjdfb7
@ONENewsNZ Wasn't that Dame Malvina Major on the cruise ship at Gallipoli though TV1 didn't mention her.
Very impressed with @ChristchurchLib 's fingertip.library.Other orgs could learn much re immediacy of response via online chat satisfaction.
Jim Mora's Panel feels like a job creation scheme for retired hacks and PR trouts.
Queuing again at Island Bay New World. Eftpos has gone down. Must be 100 people in shop. http://t.co/9YXepEqM8q
What a great novel Sarah Hall's Wolf Border is.Good plot, great lyrical landscape description.Kindle dictionary couldn't cope with new words
Started reading Sarah Hall's novel The Wolf Border. Fantastic so far - really vivid writing and subtle plot development & characterisation.
Good to hear Kim Hill hasn't lost her edge. Love the tone and inflections in her voice as she ranges from "innocent" to sarcastic.
Excellent to hear Kim Hill presenting @NzMorningReport with @GuyonEspiner. Intelligent, calm, enlightening broadcasting - good news!
Hey Karen what is a band of convergence? You were keen to point out its occurrence without enlightening us.
@vodafoneNZ We have no wifi in Buckley Rd Wellington. Can't get through on phone. No TV, no Internet. What's up?
@ohheygreat @GuySomerset So do I - my favourite writer along with Olivia Manning (for her Balkan and Levant Trilogies).
The master & Margarita - astonishing http://t.co/LadavbE9ea
My feet are deforming my shoes.
@saniac Maybe a type of fatsia japonica?
Sister is watching Magnum PI. One of the actors is named Dick Butkus:)
Good for Mutt Lange gifting his unwanted sheep station to the NZ nation. He should be made Sir Mutt.
Major whiteout with the sun suddenly obscured as storm rolls in #Wellington http://t.co/u40F8Xf8x5
Just finished Stephanie de Montalk's How does it hurt. Reminded of Denton Welch's poetic memoir of pain. Chronic pain is akin to depression
Chiefs coach Swarbrick says Chiefs are learning "how you go from mild mannered man on the street to being a beast at game time". Love this:)

Aussies have 3 handsome fast bowlers who look like Errol Flynn.
Steven Seager's Behind the gates of Gomorrah - a must read & frightening indictment of California's criminal justice system & psych wards.
Thought Desmond Dekker's Israelites was "get up in the morning same thing for breakfast" but is "get up in the morningslaving for bread sir"
High praise for Tama Waititi's What we do in the shadows from @newyorker's film critic Anthony Lane.
@katieabradford David Dougherty compensated in 2001 not 2011.
Can anyone identify this flowering tree in the main street of Taumurunui? A bit like hydrangea but don't think it is http://t.co/vsdROlCXJO
TV1 invites us to join them for a "mischeevious" hour.Jeez.
Can't remember when I last read such a heartbreaking work of staggering genius as Matthew Thomas's "We are not ourselves" - wonderful novel.
